aboutme: Hello, World! My name is Giulio Carota. Born in Melfi(PZ), Italy, in 1998. Five years of computer engineering studies, specialization in Cloud Computing and Computer and Mobile Networks. Great teamplayer, curious, enterprising andfascinatedby other people's knowledge. If requested, always ready to mediate and participate in conflicts resolution. Problem-solving attitude (evaluated critical issues and generated solutions in many experiences). Familiar with Data Center Networks, Open and Virtualized Optical Networks (academic courses andpersonal insights). Greatinterestin NFV, SDN and Network automation(ONAPintroductioncourse). Experience invirtualization,network administration, many programming languages, versioning control platforms and OS. Fluent professional English(C1) and native Italian. Always learning and looking forward for new challanges

education.title: Master Degree - Computer Networks And Cloud Computing
ERASMUS+ Double Degree Master - Intelligent Communication Systems

projects.name: PYna Mood Reader
projects.description: On March 2018, my team joined the Clik@Polito's hackathon. To respond to the challenge's request, we created a smart, internet and domotic compliant device: PYna Mood Reader.  This unique device can detect autonomously the mood and orchestrate multiple IoT devices/services to make the environment more comfortable for the user.

projects.name: TheSurvey WebAPP
projects.description: TheSurvey is a simple webapp created using react and express.js. The project was created as an assignement solution. This app allows users to create and submit surveys and then check the results through a reserved dashboard.

projects.name: Elastic Optical Network Simulator
projects.description: EONS software can simulate Virtualized and Elastic Optical networks based on DVWDM and ROADM with a centralized control plane approach

projects.name: ResilientNet / Web File Manager
projects.description: A web filemanager backend which allows clients to interact with the filesystem through a REST API. The project is intented for accessing own web hosting directories after being authenitcated by ResilientNet IDP Server

projects.name: ResilientNet / Home Lab
projects.description: ResilientLAB is a homelab built during the second wave of the covid pandemic in Italy. Starting from 0 I've set my infrastructure based on recycled hardware to host an Hypervisor + some kubernetes nodes on which I am building a small cloud environment

projects.name: ResilientNet / APIs
projects.description: Under construction API server, allows clients to interact with different backend services and manage subscriptions to them

projects.name: ResilientNet / Identity Provider
projects.description: Implementation of an IDP to provide authentication for Cloud Applications and Customers. Exploits SAML2 and OpenID Connect protocols.
